name: places/ChIJYbHolPz1wokRl8IM5LxK51Y
formattedAddress: Inside Costco Complex, 517 E 117th St, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: Inside Costco Complex, 517 E 117th St, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: I needed an eye exam (it'd been 4 years).  I live on the UWS and my first thought was to go to Cohen's Optical, however, after looking at some of the negative reviews online, I decided to go to Costco for my eye exam.  I read that you could go without being a member.  I went in without any appointment at about 1pm on a Friday.  The friendly secretary had me fill out a quick 2-page form.  I waited for about 1-2 minutes (very reasonable!) before seeing the doctor.  Dr. Unnati Upadhyay gave me a very thorough examination and I got the sense that she was an expert in her field.  The eye exam cost $65.00.  The whole thing took only about 10-15 minutes.  I would not hesitate to come back again. Thanks.

originalText.text:
I first saw Dr.Gillian George and then on the free follow up I was seen by Dr. Unnati Upadhyay (Dr.U) at East River Eye Center in Costco at 117th St., NYC. Both doctors were careful, smart and very nice, just fantastic!
I had arrived early and was seen after just a few minutes with a very thorough exam. All without being a member.
It had been too long since I had seen anyone and needed a new pair of glasses as my vision had changed. Both of them were very professional, highly qualified, knowledgeable, caring and concerned that I understood all my issues.
I have astigmatism in one eye and unusual eye dominance but Dr. George fitted me perfectly with glasses and gave me a pair of contacts to try for a week with the option to try a different prescription if I preferred at the follow up.
I had never had contacts fit me so perfectly but found that I would also need computer glasses (my sight has changed a bit). At the follow up I saw Dr. Upadhyay, who rechecked everything and did an extra exam for computer glasses as well as readers for use with the contacts, all without charging anything extra!
I highly recommend both these doctors and will be going back as good doctors are to often hard to find.

originalText.text: Dr. Upadhyay is the best medical professional that I have encountered in 11 years of living in New York City. Her office was incredibly clean and organized, I had very little wait time, she was extraordinarily cordial and absolutely knew her stuff! She took her time to explain everything to me and so I was able to understand things about my vision that I never have been able to before. She’s incredibly intelligent and just so lovely. I can’t wait to go back and see her again. What incredible service! I couldn’t recommend her more highly.

originalText.text: Dr. U is the most professional, thorough and compassionate doctor  in all of NYC. I know this from personal experience as DR. U saved my life. I have utilized DR. U for three years for eye exams for my wife and I when Dr. U discovered that my optic nerves were severely swollen. she immediately sent me to NY Eye and Ear Infirmary in Manhattan for opthalmic review and MRI. Five days later, I had emergency surgery to remove a tumor from my brain. Fast forward, my vision is perfect and I am back to normal. Dr. U is a hero!!!!! I recommend her without hesitation.

originalText.text:
Dr. Upadhyay is the best optometrist I have ever encountered. I have a lot of eye issues--need trifocals with prisms-- but she is unfailing in her ability to determine the most comfortable and precise prescription. I'm astonished by her skill and patience.
I had a prescription filled with another doctor's office--they used Zeiss lenses but Costco uses digital only. And I wanted Zeiss lenses. But their prescription was off--had non-stop headaches and felt as if I was looking through a fishbowl. Brought lenses to Dr. Upadhyay and she determined what was wrong. Immediate relief.  I will only see Dr. Upadhyay for prescriptions from now on.

NOTE: Located within the Costco located at E. 117th St, you do not have to be a Costco member to see her. Just make an appointment and let front door Costco reps know of this.
